channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CT

item.title: Report X-2024060617
item.description:
Report X-2024060617

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-05
  • City: HARTFORD
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: EMPLOYEE CALLED FOR LEAKER AT 308 ON THE BELT. RESPONDER DONNED PPE AND WENT TO THE LOCATION. THE LOADER TOLD RESPONDER THAT HE PICK UP THE BOX AND FELT THAT IT WAS WET ON THE BOTTOM. RESPONDER INSPECTED THE PACKAGE AND FOUND IT WAS WET ON THE BOTTOM. RESPONDER PLACED IT IN A LINED SPILL TUB AND BROUGHT IT TO THE DMP.

item.title: Report X-2024060060
item.description:
Report X-2024060060

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-01
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The box is marked with a corrosive diamond. The side of the box is wet and ripped open. The box is wet from the leaking 1X1 Gal bottle of Carbon Buster. All the bottles came out of the box. 1 bottle is crushed causing it to leak. The other bottles are soiled from the leakage.

item.title: Report E-2024060110
item.description:
Report E-2024060110

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-09
  • City: SOUTHINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When loading freight into trailer forklift operator went to pick up a pallet of drums and when doing so he struck a drum with the forkblades consequently puncturing it contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured drum.

item.description:
